conclusion: Principles of light and shadows affect shadow changes.
Shadows move closer to objects when light source moves downward.
Shadows become larger when light source moves downward.
Shadow A will move closer to the ice cream and become larger.
Shadow B will move closer to the typewriter and expand in size.
Shadow C will shift closer to the ball and grow in size.
Shadow D will move closer to the cylinder and enlarge.
Image shows shadows after light source moved downward.
Original position of light source is higher, casting shadows at a distance.
Shadows move closer and become larger due to smaller angle of incidence.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D move closer to objects and increase in size.
